titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the François Barbé-Marbois Letter, 1786 June 29
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, 2017

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letter, intended recipient unknown but possibly the Chevalier de Brun, written from Port-au-Prince, Saint Domingue, where Barbé-Marbois served as intendant for the French government. Concerns contraband and commercial relations between the French West Indies and the United States.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: François Barbé-Marbois letter, 1786 June 29, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2017.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: French government representative in Saint Domingue (now Haiti). Later negotiated the sale of Louisiana Territory to the United States.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letter, intended recipient unknown but possibly the Chevalier de Brun, written from Port-au-Prince, Saint Domingue, where Barbé-Marbois served as intendant for the French government. Concerns contraband and commercial relations between the French West Indies and the United States.

controlaccess.subject: Smuggling -- West Indies, French
controlaccess.geogname: West Indies, French -- Commerce -- United States
